revised_title: Internal Waves Generated by Flow Over Rough Continental Slope Topography
tldr: This article examines the generation of internal lee waves by the flow of a stratified fluid over a rough sloping plane, specifically focusing on the effect of continental slopes on ocean circulation and mixing. The study considers an idealized situation with uniform mean slope and two-dimensional ripples, analyzing the consequences of energy transfer by the lee waves and their preference for onshore transfer.
